subject: Sleep
title: Heart Rate During Sleep
description: A micro-lesson that makes Heart Rate During Sleep usable.

hook.text: Your heart beats about 100,000 times a day. During sleep, it finally gets a chance to slow down.

buildup.text: In deep NREM sleep, heart rate drops 10 to 30 percent below your normal waking rate.

discovery.text: Blood pressure also falls. This nightly dip gives the cardiovascular system critical recovery time.

twist.text: People who sleep less than six hours lose this dip. Their hearts never get a proper rest period.

climax.text: Chronic short sleep raises heart attack risk by up to 20 percent. The heart needs its nightly break.

punchline.text: Sleep is the only rest your heart gets all day.

quiz.question: What happens to heart rate during deep sleep?
options: It stays the same as waking
